Class BHBlob

java.lang.Object
  BHBlob
Direct Known Subclasses:
BHCompoundBlob, BHSingleBlob
public class BHBlob
extends java.lang.Object

This class serves as a base class for BHSingleBlob and BHCompoundBlob. It provides a container for the selection and results of measurments.

This class also provides a small number of generic methods for the computation of stats. Because I made the Blob-to-SingleBlob and Blob-to-CompoundBlob an inheritance relationship rather than an interface relationship I sometimes get awkward calling sequences. I often think I'll regret this choice later because all of the java advice is to interface-interface-interface.

CONCEPTUAL FRAMEWORK: A bi-level 2d image is comprised of foreground and background features. Contiguous groups of pixels are considered SingleBlobs CompoundBlobs are comprised of one or more SingleBlobs

Contact: Mike Sieracki, msieracki@bigelow.org
Author: Ben Tupper, btupper@bigelow.org
History: Developed over the course of 2009 and 2010 using ImageJ 1.43 and Mac OSX 10.5.8
at Bigelow Laboratory for Ocean Science, www.bigelow.org

2010-02-27 BTT switch to using Calibration for managing coordinate conversion

protected  double computeMoment(double x, double x0, double y, double y0, int p, int q, double value)
          Computes the p-q order centralized moments of x and y about the centroid x0, y0 result = value * (x-x0)^p * (y-y0)^q
protected  double computeMoment(int x, double x0, int y, double y0, int p, int q, double value)
          A wrapper around computeMoment where x and y are integers
protected  void computeMoments(BHPoint[] p)
          Computes the the moments, centralized moments, normalized centralized moments and Hu moment invariants described in Gonzales and Woods 3d edition and elsewhere NOTE 2009-10-20 There is some duplication between the "old" system and this new system the old could be removed...
protected  double computeNormMoment(double u, double u0, int p, int q)
          Computes normalized centralized moments
protected  double computeVol_SKEDM(BHSingleBlob blob)
          Computes the volume using the product of the skeletonization (SK) and the Euclidean Distance Map (EDM) for BHSingleBlob class objects.

bfd

mvol

public double mvol
mvol is the mechanical "biovolume" estimate" using various methods VOL_SVW uses Sieracki, Viles and Webb (1989) VOL_ABD simply converts area based diameter to volume using 4/3*pi*(ABD/2)^3 VOL_NONE skips the calculation and makes mvol=0

VOL_SKEDM

public static int VOL_SKEDM
VOL_SKEDM estimate volume by multipling EDM by skeleton. The result is used as an estimate of the particle radius, r, at that location. Summing disks of radius r and thickness equal to 1 pixel is the volume. VOL_SVW estimates volume with Sieracki Viles and Webb volume-by-slice integeration. See the SVW reference. VOL_ABD estimates the volume using 4/3*pi*r^3. R is determined by backwards solving area=pi*r^2. VOL_NONE means don't compute volume. VOL_AUTO currently uses VOL_SKEDM where solidity < 0.4 and uses VOL_SVW otherwise.

VOL_SVW

public static int VOL_SVW
VOL_SKEDM estimate volume by multipling EDM by skeleton. The result is used as an estimate of the particle radius, r, at that location. Summing disks of radius r and thickness equal to 1 pixel is the volume. VOL_SVW estimates volume with Sieracki Viles and Webb volume-by-slice integeration. See the SVW reference. VOL_ABD estimates the volume using 4/3*pi*r^3. R is determined by backwards solving area=pi*r^2. VOL_NONE means don't compute volume. VOL_AUTO currently uses VOL_SKEDM where solidity < 0.4 and uses VOL_SVW otherwise.

VOL_ABD

public static int VOL_ABD
VOL_SKEDM estimate volume by multipling EDM by skeleton. The result is used as an estimate of the particle radius, r, at that location. Summing disks of radius r and thickness equal to 1 pixel is the volume. VOL_SVW estimates volume with Sieracki Viles and Webb volume-by-slice integeration. See the SVW reference. VOL_ABD estimates the volume using 4/3*pi*r^3. R is determined by backwards solving area=pi*r^2. VOL_NONE means don't compute volume. VOL_AUTO currently uses VOL_SKEDM where solidity < 0.4 and uses VOL_SVW otherwise.

VOL_NONE

public static int VOL_NONE
VOL_SKEDM estimate volume by multipling EDM by skeleton. The result is used as an estimate of the particle radius, r, at that location. Summing disks of radius r and thickness equal to 1 pixel is the volume. VOL_SVW estimates volume with Sieracki Viles and Webb volume-by-slice integeration. See the SVW reference. VOL_ABD estimates the volume using 4/3*pi*r^3. R is determined by backwards solving area=pi*r^2. VOL_NONE means don't compute volume. VOL_AUTO currently uses VOL_SKEDM where solidity < 0.4 and uses VOL_SVW otherwise.

VOL_AUTO

public static int VOL_AUTO
VOL_SKEDM estimate volume by multipling EDM by skeleton. The result is used as an estimate of the particle radius, r, at that location. Summing disks of radius r and thickness equal to 1 pixel is the volume. VOL_SVW estimates volume with Sieracki Viles and Webb volume-by-slice integeration. See the SVW reference. VOL_ABD estimates the volume using 4/3*pi*r^3. R is determined by backwards solving area=pi*r^2. VOL_NONE means don't compute volume. VOL_AUTO currently uses VOL_SKEDM where solidity < 0.4 and uses VOL_SVW otherwise.

initialize

protected void initialize(Calibration cal)
Initialize - sets everyhting to 0 and empties the containers It does NOT reset the label. NOTE: pixel scaling and offset info as [units per pixel, offset in unit]. Note that realLocation = unitsPerPixel * pixelLocation + offsetInUnits. So we might have x = xscale[0] * xPixel + xscale[1]

Parameters:
cal - The calibration class that provides spatial calibration.

public PolygonRoi getEllipseRoi(BHSingleBlob b)
Returns a contour of the equivalent ellipse see Imaging Book section 11.4

Parameters:
b - A BHSingleBlob from which to compute the ellipse
Returns:
A PolygonRoi (see ij.gui.PolygonRoi) with 90 vertices.

b - A BHCompoundBlob from which to compute the ellipse
Returns:
A PolygonRoi (see ij.gui.PolygonRoi) with 90 vertices.

computeFeret

public double[] computeFeret(int[][] p)
Computes the 7-element ferets - this is based heavily (almost indentically) on ImageJ's ij.gui,Roi.getFeretValues(). This will return slightly different values since the definition of the polygon describing the boundary differs from ImageJ's Wand tool. Computes [max, angle, min, x0, y0, mean, median] where x0, y0 are the points along the boundary through which the max feret passes at the angle (in radians)

Parameters:
p - the [npoints][2] array of coordinates - typically the outer contour or contours.
Returns:
a 7-element array of [max, angle, min, x0, y0, mean, median]

createProcessor

public ImageProcessor createProcessor()
Creates a processor of the correct width and height and populated with pixel values - background is 0. The edge padding defaults to 4.

createProcessor

public ImageProcessor createProcessor(int pad)
Create a blank processor of the suitable width and height

Parameters:
pad - the number of pixels to pad around the object

isTouching

public int isTouching(int w,
                      int h)
Returns the appropriate touching flag for the specifed width and height

isTouching

public int isTouching(int xs,
                      int ys,
                      int w,
                      int h)
Returns the appropriate touching flag for the specifed width and height

Parameters:
xs - the staring coordinate of the image in pixels (generally 0)
ys - the staring coordinate of the image in pixels (generally 0)
w - the width of the image in pixels
h - the height of the image in pixels
Returns:
an integer combination of NONE, LEFT, RIGHT, TOP and BOTTOM indicating where the object encounters the edge of the image

rint

public double rint(double value)
A method for rounding that avoids rounding to the nearest even number - found in Math.rint(double) - so this required for application of the SVW volume estimate.

computeVol_SKEDM

protected double computeVol_SKEDM(BHSingleBlob blob)
Computes the volume using the product of the skeletonization (SK) and the Euclidean Distance Map (EDM) for BHSingleBlob class objects.

Parameters:
blob - the BHSingleBlob object

                               double value)

computeMoment

protected double computeMoment(double x,
                               double x0,
                               double y,
                               double y0,
                               int p,
                               int q,
                               double value)
Computes the p-q order centralized moments of x and y about the centroid x0, y0 result = value * (x-x0)^p * (y-y0)^q

computeNormMoment

protected double computeNormMoment(double u,
                                   double u0,
                                   int p,
                                   int q)
Computes normalized centralized moments

computeMoments

protected void computeMoments(BHPoint[] p)
Computes the the moments, centralized moments, normalized centralized moments and Hu moment invariants described in Gonzales and Woods 3d edition and elsewhere NOTE 2009-10-20 There is some duplication between the "old" system and this new system the old could be removed... but be careful about compatability issues. Essentially, the uXX values can replace the xsum, etc values

Parameters:
p - An array of BHPpoints

computeEllipse

protected void computeEllipse()
Computes the ellipse semi-major and semi-minor axes as well as the eccentricity. Uses current state of matchEllipseMoments to enable/disable axes scaling of ellipse.

computeEllipse

protected void computeEllipse(boolean scale)
Computes the ellipse semi-major and semi-minor axes as well as the eccentricity.

Parameters:
scale - if true causes the axes to be normalized so that the central moments of the ellipse match the original blob
